intro: Minuartia inamoena, commonly known as the white sandstone saxifrage, is a low-growing flowering plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are typically linear and covered in fine hairs, adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Minuartia inamoena thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in tundra and mountainous habitats.
